trans-unit.source: Use Hadoop Oozie in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use Hadoop Oozie in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Use Hadoop Oozie in HDInsight, a big data service. Learn how to define an Oozie workflow, and submit an Oozie job.
trans-unit.target: Use Hadoop Oozie in HDInsight, a big data service. Learn how to define an Oozie workflow, and submit an Oozie job.

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Apache Oozie to define a workflow that uses Hive and Sqoop, and then run the workflow on a Linux-based HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Apache Oozie to define a workflow that uses Hive and Sqoop, and then run the workflow on a Linux-based HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Apache Oozie is a workflow/coordination system that manages Hadoop jobs.
trans-unit.target: Apache Oozie is a workflow/coordination system that manages Hadoop jobs.

trans-unit.source: It is integrated with the Hadoop stack, and it supports Hadoop jobs for Apache MapReduce, Apache Pig, Apache Hive, and Apache Sqoop.
trans-unit.target: It is integrated with the Hadoop stack, and it supports Hadoop jobs for Apache MapReduce, Apache Pig, Apache Hive, and Apache Sqoop.

trans-unit.source: It can also be used to schedule jobs that are specific to a system, like Java programs or shell scripts
trans-unit.target: It can also be used to schedule jobs that are specific to a system, like Java programs or shell scripts

trans-unit.source: Another option for defining workflows with HDInsight is Azure Data Factory.
trans-unit.target: Another option for defining workflows with HDInsight is Azure Data Factory.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about Azure Data Factory, see <linkText>Use Pig and Hive with Data Factory[azure-data-factory-pig-hive]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To learn more about Azure Data Factory, see <linkText>Use Pig and Hive with Data Factory[azure-data-factory-pig-hive]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription: See Get Azure free trial.
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription: See Get Azure free trial.

trans-unit.source: Azure CLI: See Install and Configure the Azure CLI
trans-unit.target: Azure CLI: See Install and Configure the Azure CLI

trans-unit.source: An HDInsight cluster: See Get Started with HDInsight on Linux
trans-unit.target: An HDInsight cluster: See Get Started with HDInsight on Linux

trans-unit.source: An Azure SQL database: This will be created using the steps in this document
trans-unit.target: An Azure SQL database: This will be created using the steps in this document

trans-unit.source: The workflow you will implement by following the instructions in this document contains two actions.
trans-unit.target: The workflow you will implement by following the instructions in this document contains two actions.

trans-unit.source: Actions are definitions for tasks, such as running Hive, Sqoop, MapReduce, or other process:
trans-unit.target: Actions are definitions for tasks, such as running Hive, Sqoop, MapReduce, or other process:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Workflow diagram</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Workflow diagram</linkText>

trans-unit.source: A Hive action runs a HiveQL script to extract records from the hivesampletable included with HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: A Hive action runs a HiveQL script to extract records from the hivesampletable included with HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Each row of data describes a visit from a specific mobile device.
trans-unit.target: Each row of data describes a visit from a specific mobile device.

trans-unit.source: The record format appears similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: The record format appears similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: The Hive script used in this document counts the total visits for each platform (such as Android or iPhone,) and stores the counts to a new Hive table.
trans-unit.target: The Hive script used in this document counts the total visits for each platform (such as Android or iPhone,) and stores the counts to a new Hive table.

trans-unit.source: For more information about Hive, see <linkText>Use Hive with HDInsight[hdinsight-use-hive]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about Hive, see <linkText>Use Hive with HDInsight[hdinsight-use-hive]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: A Sqoop action exports the contents of the new Hive table to a table in an Azure SQL database.
trans-unit.target: A Sqoop action exports the contents of the new Hive table to a table in an Azure SQL database.

trans-unit.source: For more information about Sqoop, see <linkText>Use Hadoop Sqoop with HDInsight[hdinsight-use-sqoop]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about Sqoop, see <linkText>Use Hadoop Sqoop with HDInsight[hdinsight-use-sqoop]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For supported Oozie versions on HDInsight clusters, see <linkText>What's new in the Hadoop cluster versions provided by HDInsight?[hdinsight-versions]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For supported Oozie versions on HDInsight clusters, see <linkText>What's new in the Hadoop cluster versions provided by HDInsight?[hdinsight-versions]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Oozie expects resources required for a job to be stored in the same directory.
trans-unit.target: Oozie expects resources required for a job to be stored in the same directory.

trans-unit.source: This example uses wasb:///tutorials/useoozie.
trans-unit.target: This example uses wasb:///tutorials/useoozie.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to create this directory, and the data directory that will hold the new Hive table created by this workflow:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to create this directory, and the data directory that will hold the new Hive table created by this workflow:

trans-unit.source: The -p parameter caused all directories in the path to be created if they do not already exist.
trans-unit.target: The -p parameter caused all directories in the path to be created if they do not already exist.

trans-unit.source: The data directory will be used to hold data used by the useooziewf.hql script.
trans-unit.target: The data directory will be used to hold data used by the useooziewf.hql script.

trans-unit.source: Also run the following command, which ensures that Oozie can impersonate your user account when running Hive and Sqoop jobs.
trans-unit.target: Also run the following command, which ensures that Oozie can impersonate your user account when running Hive and Sqoop jobs.

trans-unit.source: Replace USERNAME with your login name:
trans-unit.target: Replace USERNAME with your login name:

trans-unit.source: If you receive an error that the user is already a member of users, you can just ignore it.
trans-unit.target: If you receive an error that the user is already a member of users, you can just ignore it.

trans-unit.source: Since this workflow uses Sqoop to export data to SQL Database, you must provide a copy of the JDBC driver used to talk to SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Since this workflow uses Sqoop to export data to SQL Database, you must provide a copy of the JDBC driver used to talk to SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to copy it to the working directory:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to copy it to the working directory:

trans-unit.source: If your workflow used other resources, such as a jar containing a MapReduce application, you would need to add these as well.
trans-unit.target: If your workflow used other resources, such as a jar containing a MapReduce application, you would need to add these as well.

trans-unit.source: Use the following steps to create a HiveQL script that defines a query, which will be used in an Oozie workflow later in this document.
trans-unit.target: Use the following steps to create a HiveQL script that defines a query, which will be used in an Oozie workflow later in this document.

trans-unit.target: Use SSH to connect to the Linux-based HDInsight cluster:

trans-unit.target: Linux, Unix or OS X clients: See Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, OS X or Unix

trans-unit.source: Windows clients: See Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows
trans-unit.target: Windows clients: See Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to create a new file:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to create a new file:

trans-unit.source: Once the nano editor opens, use the following as the contents of the file:
trans-unit.target: Once the nano editor opens, use the following as the contents of the file:

trans-unit.source: There are two variables used in the script:
trans-unit.target: There are two variables used in the script:

trans-unit.source: ${hiveTableName}: will contain the name of the table to be created
trans-unit.target: ${hiveTableName}: will contain the name of the table to be created

trans-unit.source: ${hiveDataFolder}: will contain the location to store the data files for the table
trans-unit.target: ${hiveDataFolder}: will contain the location to store the data files for the table

trans-unit.source: The workflow definition file (workflow.xml in this tutorial) passes these values to this HiveQL script at run time.
trans-unit.target: The workflow definition file (workflow.xml in this tutorial) passes these values to this HiveQL script at run time.

trans-unit.source: Press Ctrl-X to exit the editor.
trans-unit.target: Press Ctrl-X to exit the editor.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, select Y to save the file, then use Enter to use the useooziewf.hql file name.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, select Y to save the file, then use Enter to use the useooziewf.hql file name.

trans-unit.source: Use the following commands to copy useooziewf.hql to wasb:///tutorials/useoozie/useooziewf.hql:
trans-unit.target: Use the following commands to copy useooziewf.hql to wasb:///tutorials/useoozie/useooziewf.hql:

trans-unit.source: These commands store the useooziewf.hql file on the Azure Storage account associated with this cluster, which will preserve the file even if the cluster is deleted.
trans-unit.target: These commands store the useooziewf.hql file on the Azure Storage account associated with this cluster, which will preserve the file even if the cluster is deleted.

trans-unit.source: This allows you to save money by deleting clusters when they aren't in use, while maintaining your jobs and workflows.
trans-unit.target: This allows you to save money by deleting clusters when they aren't in use, while maintaining your jobs and workflows.

trans-unit.source: Oozie workflows definitions are written in hPDL (a XML Process Definition Language).
trans-unit.target: Oozie workflows definitions are written in hPDL (a XML Process Definition Language).

trans-unit.source: Use the following steps to define the workflow:
trans-unit.target: Use the following steps to define the workflow:

trans-unit.source: Use the following statement to create and edit a new file:
trans-unit.target: Use the following statement to create and edit a new file:

trans-unit.source: Once the nano editor opens, enter the following as the file contents:
trans-unit.target: Once the nano editor opens, enter the following as the file contents:

trans-unit.source: There are two actions defined in the workflow:
trans-unit.target: There are two actions defined in the workflow:

trans-unit.source: RunHiveScript: This is the start action, and runs the useooziewf.hql Hive script
trans-unit.target: RunHiveScript: This is the start action, and runs the useooziewf.hql Hive script

trans-unit.source: RunSqoopExport: This exports the data created from the Hive script to SQL Database using Sqoop.
trans-unit.target: RunSqoopExport: This exports the data created from the Hive script to SQL Database using Sqoop.

trans-unit.source: This will only run if the RunHiveScript action is successful.
trans-unit.target: This will only run if the RunHiveScript action is successful.

trans-unit.source: For more information about Oozie workflow and using workflow actions, see <linkText>Apache Oozie 4.0 documentation[apache-oozie-400]</linkText><title></title> (for HDInsight version 3.0) or <linkText>Apache Oozie 3.3.2 documentation[apache-oozie-332]</linkText><title></title> (for HDInsight version 2.1).
trans-unit.target: For more information about Oozie workflow and using workflow actions, see <linkText>Apache Oozie 4.0 documentation[apache-oozie-400]</linkText><title></title> (for HDInsight version 3.0) or <linkText>Apache Oozie 3.3.2 documentation[apache-oozie-332]</linkText><title></title> (for HDInsight version 2.1).

trans-unit.source: Note that the workflow has several entries, such as ${jobTracker}, that will be replaced by values you use in the job definition later in this document.
trans-unit.target: Note that the workflow has several entries, such as ${jobTracker}, that will be replaced by values you use in the job definition later in this document.

trans-unit.source: Also note the sqljdbc4.jar entry in the Sqoop section. This instructs Oozie to make this archive available for Sqoop when this action runs.
trans-unit.target: Also note the sqljdbc4.jar entry in the Sqoop section. This instructs Oozie to make this archive available for Sqoop when this action runs.

trans-unit.source: Use Ctrl-X, then Y and Enter to save the file.
trans-unit.target: Use Ctrl-X, then Y and Enter to save the file.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to copy the workflow.xml file to wasb:///tutorials/useoozie/workflow.xml:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to copy the workflow.xml file to wasb:///tutorials/useoozie/workflow.xml:

trans-unit.source: The following steps create the Azure SQL Database that data will be exported to.
trans-unit.target: The following steps create the Azure SQL Database that data will be exported to.

trans-unit.source: Before performing these steps you must <linkText>install and configure the Azure CLI</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Before performing these steps you must <linkText>install and configure the Azure CLI</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Installing the CLI and following the steps to create a database can be performed either from the HDInsight cluster or your local workstation.
trans-unit.target: Installing the CLI and following the steps to create a database can be performed either from the HDInsight cluster or your local workstation.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to create a new Azure SQL Database server:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to create a new Azure SQL Database server:

trans-unit.source: For exmaple, azure sql server create admin password "West US".
trans-unit.target: For exmaple, azure sql server create admin password "West US".

trans-unit.source: When the command completes, you will receive a response similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: When the command completes, you will receive a response similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: Note the server name returned by this command (i1qwc540ts in the example above.)
trans-unit.target: Note the server name returned by this command (i1qwc540ts in the example above.)

trans-unit.source: This is the short name of the SQL Database server that was created.
trans-unit.target: This is the short name of the SQL Database server that was created.

trans-unit.source: The fully qualified domain name (FQDN) is <shortname>.database.windows.net.
trans-unit.target: The fully qualified domain name (FQDN) is <shortname>.database.windows.net.

trans-unit.source: For the example above, the FQDN would be i1qwc540ts.database.windows.net.
trans-unit.target: For the example above, the FQDN would be i1qwc540ts.database.windows.net.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to create a database named oozietest on the SQL Database server:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to create a database named oozietest on the SQL Database server:

trans-unit.source: This will return an "OK" message when it completes.
trans-unit.target: This will return an "OK" message when it completes.

trans-unit.source: If you receive an error indicating that you do not have access, you may need to add the system's IP address to the SQL Database firewall using the following command:
trans-unit.target: If you receive an error indicating that you do not have access, you may need to add the system's IP address to the SQL Database firewall using the following command:

trans-unit.source: sql firewallrule create [options]
trans-unit.target: sql firewallrule create [options]

trans-unit.source: There are many ways to connect to SQL Database to create a table.
trans-unit.target: There are many ways to connect to SQL Database to create a table.

trans-unit.source: The following steps use <linkText>FreeTDS</linkText><title></title> from the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: The following steps use <linkText>FreeTDS</linkText><title></title> from the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.target: Use the following command to install FreeTDS on the HDInsight cluster:

trans-unit.source: Once FreeTDS has been installed, use the following command to connect to the SQL Database server you created previously:
trans-unit.target: Once FreeTDS has been installed, use the following command to connect to the SQL Database server you created previously:

trans-unit.source: You will receive output similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: You will receive output similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: At the 1> prompt, enter the following lines:
trans-unit.target: At the 1> prompt, enter the following lines:

trans-unit.source: When the GO statement is entered, the previous statements will be evaluated.
trans-unit.target: When the GO statement is entered, the previous statements will be evaluated.

trans-unit.source: This will create a new table named mobiledata that will be written to by Sqoop.
trans-unit.target: This will create a new table named mobiledata that will be written to by Sqoop.

trans-unit.source: Use the following to verify that the table has been created:
trans-unit.target: Use the following to verify that the table has been created:

trans-unit.source: You should see output similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: You should see output similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: Enter exit at the 1> prompt to exit the tsql utility.
trans-unit.target: Enter exit at the 1> prompt to exit the tsql utility.

trans-unit.source: The job definition describes where to find the workflow.xml, as well as other files used by the workflow (such as useooziewf.hql.)
trans-unit.target: The job definition describes where to find the workflow.xml, as well as other files used by the workflow (such as useooziewf.hql.)

trans-unit.source: It also defines the values for properties used within the workflow and associated files.
trans-unit.target: It also defines the values for properties used within the workflow and associated files.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to get the full WASB address to default storage.
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to get the full WASB address to default storage.

trans-unit.source: This will be used in the configuration file in a moment:
trans-unit.target: This will be used in the configuration file in a moment:

trans-unit.source: This should return information similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: This should return information similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: Save the wasb://mycontainer@mystorageaccount.blob.core.windows.net value, as it will be used in the next steps.
trans-unit.target: Save the wasb://mycontainer@mystorageaccount.blob.core.windows.net value, as it will be used in the next steps.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to get FQDN of the cluster headnode.
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to get FQDN of the cluster headnode.

trans-unit.source: This will be used for the JobTracker address for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: This will be used for the JobTracker address for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: This will be used in the configuration file in a moment:
trans-unit.target: This will be used in the configuration file in a moment:

trans-unit.source: This will return information similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: This will return information similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: The port used for the JobTracker is 8050, so the full address to use for the JobTracker will be headnode0.CLUSTERNAME-ssh.j7.internal.cloudapp.net:8050.
trans-unit.target: The port used for the JobTracker is 8050, so the full address to use for the JobTracker will be headnode0.CLUSTERNAME-ssh.j7.internal.cloudapp.net:8050.

trans-unit.source: Use the following to create the Oozie job definition configuration:
trans-unit.target: Use the following to create the Oozie job definition configuration:

trans-unit.source: Once the nano editor opens, use the following as the contents of the file:
trans-unit.target: Once the nano editor opens, use the following as the contents of the file:

trans-unit.source: Replace all instances of wasb://mycontainer@mystorageaccount.blob.core.windows.net with the value you received earlier.
trans-unit.target: Replace all instances of wasb://mycontainer@mystorageaccount.blob.core.windows.net with the value you received earlier.

trans-unit.source: You must use the full WASB path, with the container and storage account as part of the path.
trans-unit.target: You must use the full WASB path, with the container and storage account as part of the path.

trans-unit.source: Using the short format (wasb:///) will cause the RunHiveScript action to fail when the job is started.
trans-unit.target: Using the short format (wasb:///) will cause the RunHiveScript action to fail when the job is started.

trans-unit.source: Replace JOBTRACKERADDRESS with the JobTracker/ResourceManager address you received earlier.
trans-unit.target: Replace JOBTRACKERADDRESS with the JobTracker/ResourceManager address you received earlier.

trans-unit.source: Replace YourName with your login name for the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Replace YourName with your login name for the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Replace serverName, adminLogin, and adminPassword with the information for your Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Replace serverName, adminLogin, and adminPassword with the information for your Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Most of the information in this file is used to populate the values used in the workflow.xml or ooziewf.hql files (such as ${nameNode}.)
trans-unit.target: Most of the information in this file is used to populate the values used in the workflow.xml or ooziewf.hql files (such as ${nameNode}.)

trans-unit.source: The oozie.wf.application.path entry defines where to find the workflow.xml file, which contains the workflow ran by this job.
trans-unit.target: The oozie.wf.application.path entry defines where to find the workflow.xml file, which contains the workflow ran by this job.

trans-unit.source: Use Ctrl-X, then Y and Enter to save the file.
trans-unit.target: Use Ctrl-X, then Y and Enter to save the file.

trans-unit.source: The following steps use the Oozie command to submit and manage Oozie workflows on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: The following steps use the Oozie command to submit and manage Oozie workflows on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: The Oozie command is a friendly interface over the <linkText>Oozie REST API</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: The Oozie command is a friendly interface over the <linkText>Oozie REST API</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: When using the Oozie command, you must use the FQDN for the HDInsight headnode.
trans-unit.target: When using the Oozie command, you must use the FQDN for the HDInsight headnode.

trans-unit.source: This FQDN is only accessible from the cluster, or if the cluster is on an Azure Virtual Network, from other machines on the same network.
trans-unit.target: This FQDN is only accessible from the cluster, or if the cluster is on an Azure Virtual Network, from other machines on the same network.

trans-unit.source: Use the following to obtain the URL to the Oozie service:
trans-unit.target: Use the following to obtain the URL to the Oozie service:

trans-unit.source: This will return a value similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: This will return a value similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: The http://headnode0.CLUSTERNAME-ssh.j7.internal.cloudapp.net:11000/oozie portion is the URL to use with the Oozie command.
trans-unit.target: The http://headnode0.CLUSTERNAME-ssh.j7.internal.cloudapp.net:11000/oozie portion is the URL to use with the Oozie command.

trans-unit.target: Use the following to create an environment variable for the URL, so you don't have to type it for every command:

trans-unit.target: Replace the URL with the one you received earlier.

trans-unit.source: Use the following to submit the job:
trans-unit.target: Use the following to submit the job:

trans-unit.source: This loads the job information from job.xml and submits it to Oozie, but does not run it.
trans-unit.target: This loads the job information from job.xml and submits it to Oozie, but does not run it.

trans-unit.source: Once the command completes, it should return the ID of the job.
trans-unit.target: Once the command completes, it should return the ID of the job.

trans-unit.source: For example, 0000005-150622124850154-oozie-oozi-W.
trans-unit.target: For example, 0000005-150622124850154-oozie-oozi-W.

trans-unit.source: This will be used to manage the job.
trans-unit.target: This will be used to manage the job.

trans-unit.target: View the status of the job using the following command.

trans-unit.target: Enter the job ID returned by the previous command:

trans-unit.target: This will return information similar to the following.

trans-unit.target: This job has a status of PREP, which indicates that it was submitted, but has not been started yet.

trans-unit.source: Use the following to start the job:
trans-unit.target: Use the following to start the job:

trans-unit.source: If you check the status after this command, it will be in a running state, and information will be returned for the actions within the job.
trans-unit.target: If you check the status after this command, it will be in a running state, and information will be returned for the actions within the job.

trans-unit.source: Once the task completes successfully, you can verify that the data was generated and exported to the SQL Database table by using the following commands:
trans-unit.target: Once the task completes successfully, you can verify that the data was generated and exported to the SQL Database table by using the following commands:

trans-unit.source: At the 1> prompt, enter the following:
trans-unit.target: At the 1> prompt, enter the following:

trans-unit.source: You should receive information similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: You should receive information similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: For more information on the Oozie command, see <linkText>Oozie Command Line Tool</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on the Oozie command, see <linkText>Oozie Command Line Tool</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The Oozie REST API allow you to build your own tools that work with Oozie.
trans-unit.target: The Oozie REST API allow you to build your own tools that work with Oozie.

trans-unit.source: The following are HDInsight specific information about using the Oozie REST API:
trans-unit.target: The following are HDInsight specific information about using the Oozie REST API:

trans-unit.source: URI: The REST API can be accessed from outside the cluster at https://CLUSTERNAME.azurehdinsight.net/oozie
trans-unit.target: URI: The REST API can be accessed from outside the cluster at https://CLUSTERNAME.azurehdinsight.net/oozie

trans-unit.source: Authentication: You must authenticate to the API using the cluster HTTP account (admin,) and password.
trans-unit.target: Authentication: You must authenticate to the API using the cluster HTTP account (admin,) and password.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: For more information on using the Oozie REST API, see <linkText>Oozie Web Services API</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on using the Oozie REST API, see <linkText>Oozie Web Services API</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The Oozie Web UI provides a web-based view into the status of Oozie jobs on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: The Oozie Web UI provides a web-based view into the status of Oozie jobs on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: It allows you to view job status, the job definition, configuration, a graph of the actions in the job, and logs for the job.
trans-unit.target: It allows you to view job status, the job definition, configuration, a graph of the actions in the job, and logs for the job.

trans-unit.source: You can also view details for actions within a job.
trans-unit.target: You can also view details for actions within a job.

trans-unit.source: To access the Oozie Web UI, use the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To access the Oozie Web UI, use the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Create an SSH tunnel to the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Create an SSH tunnel to the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For information on how to do this, see one of the following:
trans-unit.target: For information on how to do this, see one of the following:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Once a tunnel has been created, open the Ambari web UI in your web browser.
trans-unit.target: Once a tunnel has been created, open the Ambari web UI in your web browser.

trans-unit.source: The URI for the Ambari site is https://CLUSTERNAME.azurehdinsight.net.
trans-unit.target: The URI for the Ambari site is https://CLUSTERNAME.azurehdinsight.net.

trans-unit.source: Replace CLUSTERNAME with the name of your Linux-based HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Replace CLUSTERNAME with the name of your Linux-based HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: From the left side of the page, select Oozie, then Quick Links, and finally Oozie Web UI.
trans-unit.target: From the left side of the page, select Oozie, then Quick Links, and finally Oozie Web UI.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>image of the menus</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>image of the menus</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The Oozie Web UI defaults to displaying running Workflow Jobs.
trans-unit.target: The Oozie Web UI defaults to displaying running Workflow Jobs.

trans-unit.source: To see all workflow jobs, select All Jobs.
trans-unit.target: To see all workflow jobs, select All Jobs.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>All jobs displayed</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>All jobs displayed</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select a job to view more information about the job.
trans-unit.target: Select a job to view more information about the job.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Job info</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Job info</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Job Info tab, you can see basic job information, as well as the individual actions within the job.
trans-unit.target: From the Job Info tab, you can see basic job information, as well as the individual actions within the job.

trans-unit.source: Using the tabs at the top you can view the Job Definition, Job Configuration, access the Job Log or view a Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG) of the job.
trans-unit.target: Using the tabs at the top you can view the Job Definition, Job Configuration, access the Job Log or view a Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG) of the job.

trans-unit.source: Job Log: Select the GetLogs button to get all logs for the job, or use the Enter Search Filter field to filter logs
trans-unit.target: Job Log: Select the GetLogs button to get all logs for the job, or use the Enter Search Filter field to filter logs

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Job log</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Job log</linkText>

trans-unit.source: JobDAG: The DAG is a graphical overview of the data paths taken through the workflow
trans-unit.target: JobDAG: The DAG is a graphical overview of the data paths taken through the workflow

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Job DAG</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Job DAG</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Selecting one of the actions from the Job Info tab will bring up information for the action.
trans-unit.target: Selecting one of the actions from the Job Info tab will bring up information for the action.

trans-unit.source: For example, select the RunHiveScript action.
trans-unit.target: For example, select the RunHiveScript action.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Action info</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Action info</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can see details for the action, including a link to the Console URL, which can be used to view JobTracker information for the job.
trans-unit.target: You can see details for the action, including a link to the Console URL, which can be used to view JobTracker information for the job.

trans-unit.source: The coordinator allows you to specify a start, end, and occurrance frequency for jobs so that they can be scheduled for certain times.
trans-unit.target: The coordinator allows you to specify a start, end, and occurrance frequency for jobs so that they can be scheduled for certain times.

trans-unit.source: To define a schedule for the workflow, use the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To define a schedule for the workflow, use the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Use the following to create a new file named coordinator.xml:
trans-unit.target: Use the following to create a new file named coordinator.xml:

trans-unit.source: Use the following as the contents of the file:
trans-unit.target: Use the following as the contents of the file:

trans-unit.source: Note that this uses ${...} variables that will be replaced by values in the job definition.
trans-unit.target: Note that this uses ${...} variables that will be replaced by values in the job definition.

trans-unit.source: The variables are:
trans-unit.target: The variables are:

trans-unit.source: ${coordFrequency}: Time between running instances of the job
trans-unit.target: ${coordFrequency}: Time between running instances of the job

trans-unit.source: ${coordStart}: The job start time
trans-unit.target: ${coordStart}: The job start time

trans-unit.source: ${coordEnd}: The job end time
trans-unit.target: ${coordEnd}: The job end time

trans-unit.source: ${coordTimezone}: Coordinator jobs are in a fixed time zone with no daylight savings time (typically represented by using UTC).
trans-unit.target: ${coordTimezone}: Coordinator jobs are in a fixed time zone with no daylight savings time (typically represented by using UTC).

trans-unit.source: This time zone is referred as the "Oozie processing timezone"
trans-unit.target: This time zone is referred as the "Oozie processing timezone"

trans-unit.source: ${wfPath}: The path to the workflow.xml
trans-unit.target: ${wfPath}: The path to the workflow.xml

trans-unit.source: Use Ctrl-X, then Y and Enter to save the file.
trans-unit.target: Use Ctrl-X, then Y and Enter to save the file.

trans-unit.source: Use the following to copy it to the working directory for this job:
trans-unit.target: Use the following to copy it to the working directory for this job:

trans-unit.source: Use the following to modify the job.xml file:
trans-unit.target: Use the following to modify the job.xml file:

trans-unit.source: Make the following changes:
trans-unit.target: Make the following changes:

trans-unit.source: Change oozie.wf.application.path to oozie.coord.application.path.
trans-unit.target: Change oozie.wf.application.path to oozie.coord.application.path.

trans-unit.source: This instructs Oozie to run the coordinator file instead of the workflow file
trans-unit.target: This instructs Oozie to run the coordinator file instead of the workflow file

trans-unit.source: Add the following, which will be sets a variable used in the coordinator.xml to point to the location of the workflow.xml:
trans-unit.target: Add the following, which will be sets a variable used in the coordinator.xml to point to the location of the workflow.xml:

trans-unit.source: Replace the values for mycontainer and mystorageaccount with the values used in other entries in the job.xml file.
trans-unit.target: Replace the values for mycontainer and mystorageaccount with the values used in other entries in the job.xml file.

trans-unit.source: Add the following, which define the start, end, and frequency to use for the coordinator.xml file:
trans-unit.target: Add the following, which define the start, end, and frequency to use for the coordinator.xml file:

trans-unit.source: These set the start time to 12:00PM on June 25th, 2015, the end time to June 27th, 2015, and the interval for running this job to daily (the frequency is in minutes, so 24 hours x 60 minutes = 1440 minutes.)
trans-unit.target: These set the start time to 12:00PM on June 25th, 2015, the end time to June 27th, 2015, and the interval for running this job to daily (the frequency is in minutes, so 24 hours x 60 minutes = 1440 minutes.)

trans-unit.source: Finally, the timezone is set to UTC.
trans-unit.target: Finally, the timezone is set to UTC.

trans-unit.source: Use Ctrl-X, then Y and Enter to save the file.
trans-unit.target: Use Ctrl-X, then Y and Enter to save the file.

trans-unit.source: To run the job, use the following command:
trans-unit.target: To run the job, use the following command:

trans-unit.source: This will submit and start the job.
trans-unit.target: This will submit and start the job.

trans-unit.source: If you visit the Oozie Web UI and select the Coordinator Jobs tab, you should information similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: If you visit the Oozie Web UI and select the Coordinator Jobs tab, you should information similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>coordinator jobs tab</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>coordinator jobs tab</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Note the Next Materialization entry; this is when the job will run next.
trans-unit.target: Note the Next Materialization entry; this is when the job will run next.

trans-unit.source: Similar to the earlier workflow job, selecting the job entry in the web UI will display information on the job:
trans-unit.target: Similar to the earlier workflow job, selecting the job entry in the web UI will display information on the job:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Coordinator job info</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Coordinator job info</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Note that this only shows successful runs of the job, not individual actions within the scheduled workflow.
trans-unit.target: Note that this only shows successful runs of the job, not individual actions within the scheduled workflow.

trans-unit.source: To see that, select one of the Action entries.
trans-unit.target: To see that, select one of the Action entries.

trans-unit.source: This will display information similar to that retrieved for the earlier workflow job.
trans-unit.target: This will display information similar to that retrieved for the earlier workflow job.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Action info</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Action info</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When troubleshooting problems with Oozie jobs, the Oozie UI is very helpful as it allows you to easily view both Oozie logs, as well as links to JobTracker logs for MapReduce tasks such as Hive queries.
trans-unit.target: When troubleshooting problems with Oozie jobs, the Oozie UI is very helpful as it allows you to easily view both Oozie logs, as well as links to JobTracker logs for MapReduce tasks such as Hive queries.

trans-unit.source: In general, the pattern for troubleshooting should be:
trans-unit.target: In general, the pattern for troubleshooting should be:

trans-unit.source: View the job in Oozie Web UI.
trans-unit.target: View the job in Oozie Web UI.

trans-unit.source: If there is an error or failure for a specific action, select the action to see if the Error Message field provides more information on the failure.
trans-unit.target: If there is an error or failure for a specific action, select the action to see if the Error Message field provides more information on the failure.

trans-unit.source: If available, use the URL from the action to view more details (such as JobTracker logs,) for the action.
trans-unit.target: If available, use the URL from the action to view more details (such as JobTracker logs,) for the action.

trans-unit.source: The following are specific errors you may encounter, and how to resolve them.
trans-unit.target: The following are specific errors you may encounter, and how to resolve them.

trans-unit.source: Symptoms: The job status will change to SUSPENDED.
trans-unit.target: Symptoms: The job status will change to SUSPENDED.

trans-unit.source: Details for the job will show the RunHiveScript status as START_MANUAL.
trans-unit.target: Details for the job will show the RunHiveScript status as START_MANUAL.

trans-unit.source: Selecting the action will reveal the following error message:
trans-unit.target: Selecting the action will reveal the following error message:

trans-unit.source: Cause: The WASB addresses used in the job.xml file do not contain the storage container or storage account name.
trans-unit.target: Cause: The WASB addresses used in the job.xml file do not contain the storage container or storage account name.

trans-unit.source: The WASB address format must be wasb://containername@storageaccountname.blob.core.windows.net.
trans-unit.target: The WASB address format must be wasb://containername@storageaccountname.blob.core.windows.net.

trans-unit.source: Resolution: Change the WASB addresses used by the job.
trans-unit.target: Resolution: Change the WASB addresses used by the job.

trans-unit.source: Symptoms: The job status will change to SUSPENDED.
trans-unit.target: Symptoms: The job status will change to SUSPENDED.

trans-unit.source: Details for the job will show the RunHiveScript status as START_MANUAL.
trans-unit.target: Details for the job will show the RunHiveScript status as START_MANUAL.

trans-unit.source: Selecting the action will reveal the following error message:
trans-unit.target: Selecting the action will reveal the following error message:

trans-unit.source: Cause: Current permission settings do not allow Oozie to impersonate the specified user account.
trans-unit.target: Cause: Current permission settings do not allow Oozie to impersonate the specified user account.

trans-unit.source: Resolution: Oozie is allowed to impersonate users in the users group.
trans-unit.target: Resolution: Oozie is allowed to impersonate users in the users group.

trans-unit.source: Use the groups USERNAME to see the groups that the user account is a member of.
trans-unit.target: Use the groups USERNAME to see the groups that the user account is a member of.

trans-unit.source: If the user is not a member of the users group, use the following command to add the user to the group:
trans-unit.target: If the user is not a member of the users group, use the following command to add the user to the group:

trans-unit.source: It may take several minutes before HDInsight recognizes that the user has been added to the group.
trans-unit.target: It may take several minutes before HDInsight recognizes that the user has been added to the group.

trans-unit.source: Symptoms: The job status will changed to KILLED.
trans-unit.target: Symptoms: The job status will changed to KILLED.

trans-unit.source: Details for the job will show the RunSqoopExport status as ERROR.
trans-unit.target: Details for the job will show the RunSqoopExport status as ERROR.

trans-unit.source: Selecting the action will reveal the following error message:
trans-unit.target: Selecting the action will reveal the following error message:

trans-unit.source: Cause: Sqoop is unable to load the database driver required to access the database.
trans-unit.target: Cause: Sqoop is unable to load the database driver required to access the database.

trans-unit.source: Resolution: When using Sqoop from an Oozie job, you must include the database driver with the other resources (such as the workflow.xml,) used by the job.
trans-unit.target: Resolution: When using Sqoop from an Oozie job, you must include the database driver with the other resources (such as the workflow.xml,) used by the job.

trans-unit.source: You must also reference the archive containing the database driver from the ... section of the workflow.xml.
trans-unit.target: You must also reference the archive containing the database driver from the ... section of the workflow.xml.

trans-unit.source: For example, for the job in this document, you would use the following steps:
trans-unit.target: For example, for the job in this document, you would use the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Copy the sqljdbc4.jar file to the /tutorials/useoozie directory:
trans-unit.target: Copy the sqljdbc4.jar file to the /tutorials/useoozie directory:

trans-unit.source: Modify the workflow.xml to add the following on a new line above :
trans-unit.target: Modify the workflow.xml to add the following on a new line above :

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you learned how to define an Oozie workflow and how to run an Oozie job.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you learned how to define an Oozie workflow and how to run an Oozie job.
